items.title: Littler opens up on 'special feeling' of going back to back at Worlds
items.summary: Luke Littler has hailed the "special feeling" of joining an illustrious and short list of players who have gone back to back at the World Darts Championship.

items.title: 'Players have to rise and get stuck into Littler because he won't regress'
items.summary: Wayne Mardle says it is up to players to rise to the challenge and get "stuck into Luke Littler" after 'The Nuke' cemented his position as one of the greats of the sport.

Galaxy star Riqui Puig out until '27 after setback
items.summary: LA Galaxy star Riqui Puig's return from injury has been delayed until 2027, the LA Galaxy said Saturday after confirming that the midfielder underwent another anterior cruciate ligament reconstructive surgery on his left knee.

items.title: Amorim refuses to clarify 'time and money' claim
items.summary: Ruben Amorim has declined to expand on his claim that it will take "time and money" to make his system work at Manchester United.

items.title: Wintertransfers Eredivisie seizoen 2025/26: alle clubs op een rij

items.title: West Ham-trainer flink door het stof na vernederende nederlaag
items.summary: Wolverhampton Wanderers had dit seizoen nog geen wedstrijd gewonnen, totdat West Ham United op bezoek kwam. The Hammers gingen pijnlijk onderuit tegen de hekkensluiter van de Premier League, waardoor trainer Nuno EspÃ­rito Santo flink door het stof ging na afloop.

items.title: Arsenal reaping the rewards of Rice adding goals to his game
items.summary: Declan Rice scored twice in Arsenal's win at Bournemouth on Saturday, and with goals added to his game, is he now the best midfielder in the world?

items.title: Ruben Amorim clamming up over transfer hopes suggests faultline
items.summary: Manchester Unitedâ€™s head coach appeared downbeat when questioned over not being able to acquire enough top players to suit his preferred formation Ruben Amorim offered a collectorâ€™s item on Friday â€“ a point-blank refusal to address a question that concerned an answer he previously gave. In doing so, he hinted at a disquiet concerning the clubâ€™s transfer policy. â€œYou said youâ€™re starting to understand that to play 3-4-3, you [need] a lot of top players and thatâ€™s not possible. Can I ask why you never realised that when you first came into the club?â€ was the question put to Amorim in his press conference for Unitedâ€™s visit to Leeds on Sunday. Continue reading...

items.title: Uitgerekend Joan GarcÃ­a speelt sleutelrol bij derbyzege Barcelona
items.summary: Barcelona heeft met een knappe zege op stadgenoot Espanyol goede zaken gedaan in de strijd om de titel in La Liga. De ploeg van Hansi Flick werd zaterdagavond in de derby tot het uiterste gedreven. Vlak voor het einde maakte BarÃ§a het verschil.

items.title: Mikel Arteta lauds Arsenalâ€™s â€˜personality and presenceâ€™ in win at Bournemouth
items.summary: Manager praises â€˜remarkableâ€™ Gabriel reaction after error Rice makes impact after disappointment of missing Villa Mikel Arteta paid tribute to Arsenalâ€™s newfound â€œpersonality and presenceâ€ after they came back from a goal down to defeat Bournemouth and move six points clear at the top of the Premier League. Gabriel MagalhÃ£es made up for his error in gifting Evanilson the opening goal by lashing in the equaliser at the other end minutes later before Declan Rice scored twice after returning from a knee injury. Eli Junior Kroupi pulled one back late on but Arsenal were able to comfortably hang on as they began the new year with a fifth straight league win. Continue reading...

items.title: Premier Leagueâ€™s warped economics make Â£65m fee for Semenyo a snip | Jonathan Wilson
items.summary: Price tag for wingerâ€™s move to Manchester City would make headlines in any other country but not in England Antoine Semenyo, it seems likely, will soon join Manchester City from Bournemouth for a fee of Â£65m. Given how well Rayan Cherki and Phil Foden have played from the right this season, it is not immediately obvious why City need him, but the modern game is the modern game, the rammed calendar makes large and flexible squads essential and Pep Guardiola may have some esoteric plan for the Ghanaian anyway. But perhaps what is most striking about the deal is the fee â€“ or, more precisely, how little attention it has drawn. English football has become inured to big transfers. The fee feels about right. Semenyo is 25. He has four and a half years left on his contract. He is quick, skilful, intelligent and works hard. He is disciplined, but has the capacity to do the unexpected. Of course a player of his ability costs that much. Yet Â£65m would make him the third-most expensive player in Bundesliga history. He would be the seventh-most expensive in Serie A history, the 14th-most expensive in La Liga history. Only nine non-English clubs have paid a fee higher than that. Even in Premier League terms, Semenyo sneaks into the top 25. Continue reading...

items.title: McGinn's first Premier League double sends Villa second
items.summary: John McGinn gets two goals and Ollie Watkins scores on his 250th appearance for Aston Villa, inflicting a fourth straight league defeat upon Nottingham Forest.
